Description: Bag-type sprang hair-net of undyed linen with stripes of dense and less dense netting; seams at sides; tapering slightly at top due to the grouping of the threads in twos; a draw string was threaded through the folded top edge, and the ends knotted together; along one side of the bottom is a brow band with a narrow cord of purple and yellow wool; opposite side was originally threaded with a double draw string, now missing; warp-linen (S spun Z ply); two selvedges and two ends; side seams top sewn in linen (S spun Z ply); brow band cord in purple wool (Z) and yellow wool (S)
Curator's comments: plainess points to a comparitvely early date; similar to 12544, 18292, 21632, 21633, 37352
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces 2000 Feb-May, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Ancient Faces
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
